title: Kingfisher shares slip after reporting 6% drop in underlying profit
text: Shares of Kingfisher KGF, -1.41%, the U.K. home-improvement retailer, dipped 1.4% after saying first-half underlying pretax profit fell 6.4% to £353 million on a 1.4% fall in sales to £5.99 billion. Same-store sales fell 1.8%, on B&Q and French sales declines, despite growth in Screwfix and in Poland and Romania. It still said its margin outlook after clearance will be flat but flagged an additional £30 to £35 million in incremental clearance costs. Kingfisher said Carrefour veteran Thierry Garnier, who it previously announced was becoming CEO, will start next week, replacing Véronique Laury.
